documentation.text: Returns the name of this factory.
Returns the symbol for this factory.
Number of options the factory supports.

@dev Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to
 restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

@dev Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the
 same structure as the ERC721 metadata.
Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface()

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "SLM NFT Token Sale / Exchange Fund"

expression.value: SLM NFT Token Sale / Exchange Fund

documentation.text:
Hack to get things to work automatically on OpenSea.
 Use transferFrom so the frontend doesn't have to worry about different method names.
Override isApprovedForAll to auto-approve OS's proxy contract

Hack to get things to work automatically on OpenSea.
 Use isApprovedForAll so the frontend doesn't have to worry about different method names.
Returns the name of this factory.
Returns the symbol for this factory.
Number of options the factory supports.

@dev Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to
 restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

@dev Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the
 same structure as the ERC721 metadata.

documentation.text:
Hack to get things to work automatically on OpenSea.
 Use transferFrom so the frontend doesn't have to worry about different method names.
Override isApprovedForAll to auto-approve OS's proxy contract

Hack to get things to work automatically on OpenSea.
 Use isApprovedForAll so the frontend doesn't have to worry about different method names.

canMint(uint256).details: Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

mint(uint256,address).details: Mints asset(s) in accordance to a specific address with a particular "option". This should be callable only by the contract owner or the owner's Wyvern Proxy (later universal login will solve this). Options should also be delineated 0 - (numOptions() - 1) for convenient indexing.

params._toAddress: address of the future owner of the asset(s)

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the same structure as the ERC721 metadata.

name().notice: Returns the name of this factory.

numOptions().notice: Number of options the factory supports.

supportsFactoryInterface().notice: Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface()

symbol().notice: Returns the symbol for this factory.
